title: 11+ Ways to Make Your Boyfriend Realize Your Importance and Worth

steps.title: If you’re always on his schedule, let him plan around you instead.
steps.content: If you’re always on his schedule, let him plan around you instead. Don’t cancel plans with your friends or rush to get your work done so you two can hang out. Instead, tell him your schedule for the week, and then let him figure out when you two can hang. If he has to rearrange his life a little bit for you instead of the other way around, he’s going to appreciate just how much effort you’ve been putting into the relationship so far. [1] X Research source The same thing goes for texts and calls, too. If you feel like you’re always reaching out first, let him do it for once. He might just realize that he’s been slacking a bit in his communication efforts.

steps.title: He might feel like you’re obligated to do things for him.
steps.content: He might feel like you’re obligated to do things for him. If that’s the case, take a week off. Don’t cook for him, don’t do his laundry, and don’t remind him about his appointments. When he confronts you about it, say something like, “Oh, that slipped my mind. I thought you were going to take care of that since it’s your responsibility.” [2] X Research source It’s fine to do favors for your partner every once in a while. It only becomes an issue when your boyfriend starts to expect (or even demand) them from you.

steps.title: Let him see just how much fun you’re having!
steps.content: Let him see just how much fun you’re having! Go out to eat or have a fun afternoon with your friends. If your boyfriend asks what you’re doing, tell him that you’re going out, and he probably won’t be able to reach you for a while. He’ll most likely wonder where you are and who you’re with, and he’ll realize just how many other people you have in your life. [3] X Expert Source Julia McCurley Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. Thursday, September 30, 2021. Another good way to work your plans into conversation is by telling him you’re too busy to hang out. When he asks why, you can tell him that you’re hitting up a new bar or club with a group of friends.

steps.title: Your BF will get to scroll through your socials and see you having fun.
steps.content: Your BF will get to scroll through your socials and see you having fun. This will help him realize how fun you are (and how hot you are, too). He’ll probably regret that he didn’t take you out or put more of an effort into date night, which can motivate him to plan something fun in the future. [4] X Expert Source Julia McCurley Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. Thursday, September 30, 2021. You could also send him a few Snapchats or even text him some pics from the night.

steps.title: Make some changes in your appearance to draw attention to yourself.
steps.content: Make some changes in your appearance to draw attention to yourself. Color your hair, try out some new makeup (if you wear it), or go on a shopping spree. When you spend time on yourself, your boyfriend is sure to notice, and he might just remember why he was attracted to you in the first place. [5] X Expert Source Julia McCurley Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. Thursday, September 30, 2021. You don’t have to do anything drastic or even expensive. You can find tons of new wardrobe pieces for fairly cheap at your local thrift stores.

steps.title: This can be a little risky, so use this technique with caution.
steps.content: This can be a little risky, so use this technique with caution. If you’re out with your BF and he’s not really paying any attention to you, try going up to another guy and getting a little flirty. When your boyfriend notices, he might just be reminded that other guys are attracted to you, too. [6] X Expert Source Julia McCurley Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. Thursday, September 30, 2021. If your boyfriend has jealousy issues that you’ve talked about in the past, this probably isn’t the best option for you. Flirting with other people can be a deal breaker for some, and it’s not worth risking your relationship over.

steps.title: What are some things you liked to do when you were single?
steps.content: What are some things you liked to do when you were single? Spend time and effort on those instead of putting them on the backburner. [7] X Expert Source Julia McCurley Certified Professional Matchmaker Expert Interview. Thursday, September 30, 2021. When you tell your boyfriend about all the cool stuff that you’re doing, he’ll be reminded about just how awesome you are. If you don’t have any major hobbies that you’re into now, try something new! What’s something you’ve always wanted to do but didn’t make the time for? Now’s your chance to test it out.

steps.title: If your boyfriend has been neglecting you, gently remind him about dates.
steps.content: If your boyfriend has been neglecting you, gently remind him about dates. Ask him to take you out to a nice dinner, or plan a fun afternoon for the both of you. [8] X Expert Source Elvina Lui, MFT Marriage & Family Therapist Expert Interview. 29 May 2019. Use the time together to reconnect, and remind yourselves why you got together in the first place. Over time, you two can grow closer together and value each other like you did in the beginning of the relationship. [9] X Research source You could even make date nights a fun thing that you implement every week! Try switching back and forth between who plans them; that way, no one feels left out or like they’re taking on all the work.

steps.title: Tell your boyfriend that you’re feeling a little underappreciated.
steps.content: Tell your boyfriend that you’re feeling a little underappreciated. It’s normal to fall into a bit of a routine in long-term relationships, and chances are, your boyfriend doesn’t even know that you’ve been feeling neglected or taken advantage of lately. If these methods aren’t working or you want to open up a dialogue, sit down with your boyfriend and talk things out together. [10] X Research source For instance, you might say, “I’m not sure if you realize it, but I do a lot for you in this relationship. Lately, I’ve been feeling like you don’t really appreciate it, and it’s getting me down.”

steps.title: You and your boyfriend can work as a team to make you feel better.
steps.content: You and your boyfriend can work as a team to make you feel better. If you tell him that you're feeling underappreciated, let him know a few things he can do to fix that. Maybe ask him to take you out once a week or give you compliments when he notices that you look good. Then, you can check in about how you're both feeling to make sure you're on the right track. [11] X Research source In some cases, people will put less effort into their relationship because there's an issue they aren't addressing. Ask your boyfriend if there's anything he wants to talk about, and if there is, try to work through those problems together.

steps.title: Unfortunately, there may come a point when it’s time to break up.
steps.content: Unfortunately, there may come a point when it’s time to break up. If you and your boyfriend have talked about how you’re feeling (maybe even multiple times) and he’s still not able to change, it could spell disaster. You don’t need to make any rash decisions, but it’s something to think about—when one partner refuses to work on the relationship, the other partner is only going to get more and more resentful. [12] X Research source If you’re in a long-term relationship, consider seeing a couple’s counselor. They can help you articulate your feelings and express what you need to your boyfriend.
